      • drawMe

        protected boolean drawMe(Camera camera,
                         float[] RGB)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Draws this object at a slightly lower level access to other object drawing functions. (Meaning it directly accesses the drawing functions in the Util class). This method generally should not be called from subclasses as this is already called by the VisibleObject class, instead use: VisibleObject.drawMe(Camera). This can be overwritten but would mean that the user has to deal with the Util class drawing function. It is suggested that overrides of this method call their super.
        Overrides:
        drawMe in class VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        camera - - The Camera that is viewing this object.
        RGB - - The RBG values that designate the color of this object.
        Returns:
        A boolean that designates if the drawing of this object was successful.

      • aggroOn

        public void aggroOn(Alive setTarget)
        Makes this Alive consider the passed in Alive as its attack target. Will change the alive's attack state to selected. Might trigger buffs.
        Parameters:
        setTarget -

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(double width)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Sets the width value of this object. The width value cannot be accessed directly and must be changed through this function. It is important that the width of a new VisibleObject is set because otherwise it will default to a value of 0 and cause the entire object to not be visible.
        Overrides:
        setWidth in class VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        width - - The new width of this VisibleObject
        See Also:
        VisibleObject.getWidth(), VisibleObject.setHeight(double)

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(double height)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Sets the height value of this object. The height value cannot be accessed directly and must be changed through this function. It is important that the height of a new VisibleObject is set because otherwise it will default to a value of 0 and cause the entire object to not be visible.
        Overrides:
        setHeight in class VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        height - - The new height of this object.
        See Also:
        VisibleObject.setWidth(double), VisibleObject.getHeight()
